conversation.content: I might have mentioned something about that project, or maybe I didn't. Hard to say.
You definitely mentioned it. You said you were handling the budget review last Tuesday, remember? I need to know where we stand before the meeting tomorrow.
Well, things change. You know how it is.
No, I don't know how it is. The deadline hasn't changed, the requirements haven't changed. What specifically are you avoiding telling me here?
Who says I'm avoiding anything? That's a pretty strong accusation.
It's not an accusation, it's an observation. You've deflected three direct questions now. Look, if there's a problem with the numbers, we need to address it today.
The numbers are... complicated.
[happy] Complicated is my specialty! Seriously, that's why they brought me onto this team. Walk me through what's making them complex and we'll figure it out together.
It's not really about complexity, per se.
Then what's it about? Because you're dancing around something here and we're burning daylight. The board expects our presentation at nine tomorrow morning.
Maybe we should loop in Sarah first. Get her perspective.
Sarah's in Tokyo until Thursday. You know this because you approved her travel request. Stop stalling and tell me what's actually going on with the project.
I wouldn't call it stalling. More like... strategic consideration.
Strategic consideration is what you do before making decisions, not after missing deadlines. Did you even start the budget review or not?
Define "start."
Open the spreadsheet, input the quarterly figures, run the variance analysis. That's the start. It's literally the first three items on the checklist you created yourself.
Checklists can be somewhat flexible, don't you think?
Not when they're attached to regulatory compliance requirements, no. We need those numbers verified and submitted. This isn't optional or interpretive.
Perhaps we could request an extension. Explore our options.
The extension window closed last Friday. You signed off on the timeline six weeks ago. I'm pulling the files now and we're doing this together, tonight.
